text: David Organizes the Musicians

And David and the commanders of the army set apart for the service the sons of Asaph, \add of\add* Heman, and \add of\add* Jeduthun, who prophesied with stringed instruments, with harps, and with cymbals. And their inventory of the men of the work \add and\add* for their duty was:

for the sons of Asaph: Zakkur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah, sons of Asaph, under the hand\f + \fr 25:2 \ft That is, under the direction \f* of Asaph, who prophesied under the hands\f + \fr 25:2 \ft That is, under the direction \f* of the king.

Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah,\f + \fr 25:3 \ft One Hebrew manuscript and the LXX add “Shimei” between Jeshaiah and Heshabiah (see verse \xt 17 \ft ) \f* Heshabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands\f + \fr 25:3 \ft That is, under the direction \f* of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with the stringed instrument with thanksgiving and praise to Yahweh.
Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti and Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.

All these \add were\add* sons to Heman, the seer of the king, according to the words of God to raise a horn.\f + \fr 25:5 \ft That is, to exalt Heman \f* And God had given to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.

All these \add were\add* under the ⸤direction⸥\f + \fr 25:6 \ft Literally “hands” \f* of their father in the music of the house of Yahweh, with cymbals, harps, and stringed instruments for the service of the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman \add were\add* under the ⸤direction⸥\f + \fr 25:6 \ft Literally “hands” \f* of the king.
And their number, along with their brothers, trained singers, all the skilled people for Yahweh, were two hundred and eighty-eight.
And they cast lots \add for\add* responsibilities ⸤on the principle of small and great alike⸥,\f + \fr 25:8 \ft Literally “for like the small, like the great” \f* teacher with student.
And the first lot for Asaph went out to Joseph; the second to Gedaliahu; he and his brothers and his twelve sons.
The third, Zakkur, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
the fifth, Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
the sixth, Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
the seventh, Jesarelah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
the eighth, Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
the ninth, Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
the tenth, Shimei, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
eleventh, Azarel, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* fifteenth, to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* sixteenth, to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* seventeenth, to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* eighteenth, to Hanani, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* nineteenth, to Mallothi, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* twentieth, to Eliathah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* twenty-first, to Hothir, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
to \add the\add* twenty-second, to Giddalti, his sons and his brothers, twelve;

to \add the\add* twenty-fourth, to Romamti-ezer, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
